critique:
The document is an executive order regarding the inspection of tax returns by the Senate Committee on Rules and Administration. As the President, the primary emotion I want to elicit is a sense of trust and confidence in the government's ability to conduct oversight and maintain accountability. The tone is formal and authoritative, aiming to convey a sense of responsibility and adherence to legal procedures. There is no explicit mention of emotions, but the implicit goal is to reassure the public that the government is acting transparently and ethically. The language is precise and legalistic, which further reinforces the seriousness and legitimacy of the action. Based on this, I would score the emotions as follows:

Joy: 1 (The document is not intended to evoke joy.)
Sadness: 1 (The document is not intended to evoke sadness.)
Anger: 1 (The document is not intended to evoke anger.)
Fear: 1 (The document is not intended to evoke fear.)
Disgust: 1 (The document is not intended to evoke disgust.)
Surprise: 3 (The public might be mildly surprised by the level of access granted to the Senate committee.)
